{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode = Basketball |Year = 2009â10 |Prev year = 2008â09 |Next year = 2010â11 |Team = Gonzaga Bulldogs |Image = GU Bulldog.svg |Image_size = 150px |Conference = West Coast Conference |Division = |ShortConference = WCC |CoachRank = 22 |APRank = 22 |Record = 27–7 |ConfRecord = 12–2 |HeadCoach = [[Mark Few]] |HCYear = 11th |AsstCoach1 = [[Ray Giacoletti]] |AsstCoach2 = Leon Rice |AsstCoach3 = Tommy Lloyd |StadiumArena = [[McCarthey Athletic Center]] |Champion =Maui Invitation Champions
WCC Regular Season Champions |BowlTourney =[[2010 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Tournament]] |BowlTourneyResult =Second Round }} {{2009–10 West Coast Conference men's basketball standings}} The '''2009â10 [[Gonzaga Bulldogs men's basketball]] team''' represented [[Gonzaga University]] in the [[2009â10 NCAA Division I men's basketball season]]. The Bulldogs are members of the [[West Coast Conference]], were led by head coach [[Mark Few]], and played they home games at the [[McCarthey Athletic Center]] on the Gonzaga campus in [[Spokane, Washington]]. The Zags finished the season 27–7, 12–2 in WCC play to claim the regular season championship. They advanced to the championship game of the [[2010 West Coast Conference Men's Basketball Tournament]] before falling to [[2009â10 Saint Mary's College Gaels men's basketball team|Saint Mary's]]. They received an at–large bid to the [[2010 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament]], earning a 8 seed in the West Region. They defeated 9 seed [[2009â10 Florida State Seminoles men's basketball team|Florida State]] in the first round before losing to 1 seed and AP #4 [[2009â10 Syracuse Orange men's basketball team|Syracuse]] in the second round. ==Roster== [[File:Matt Bouldin Gonzaga.jpg|thumb|Matt Bouldin]] [[File:Elias Harris Gonzaga.jpg|thumb|Elias Harris]] [[File:Robert Sacre Gonzaga.jpg|thumb|Robert [[Ray Giacoletti]] * [[Leon Rice]] |roster_url=http://www.gozags.com/auto_pdf/p_hotos/s_chools/gonz/sports/m-baskbl/auto_pdf/09-10-roster |accessdate=2010-12-21 }} ===2009â10 team recruits=== Sam Dower was the first to sign with Gonzaga for their 2009â10 recruiting schedule on September 6, 2008.{{cite web|url=http://minnesota.scout.com/a.z?s=176&p=2&c=787822&ssf=1&RequestedURL=http%3a%2f%2fminnesota.scout.com%2f2%2f787822.html|title=Sam Dower Commits to Gonzaga|publisher=''[[MSN]]''|accessdate=2010-12-21}} He made only two visits to the schools on his recruiting list, but considered signing with the [[Marquette Golden Eagles men's basketball|Marquette Golden Eagles]], [[California Golden Bears men's basketball|California Golden Bears]], [[Minnesota Golden Gophers men's basketball|Minnesota Golden Gophers]], and the [[George Mason Patriots men's basketball|George Mason Patriots]].{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/mens-college-basketball/recruiting/player/_/id/55617|title=Samuel Dower 2009 Basketball Recruiting Profile|publisher=''[[ESPN.com]]''|accessdate=2010-12-21}} While visiting schools on his recruit list, G.J. Vilarino visited Gonzaga during the week of April 23, 2009.{{cite web|url=http://scouthoops.scout.com/a.z?s=75&p=9&c=2&cid=859177&nid=2476305&fhn=1&ssf=1&RequestedURL=http%3a%2f%2fscouthoops.scout.com%2fa.z%3fs%3d75%26p%3d9%26c%3d2%26cid%3d859177%26nid%3d2476305%26fhn%3d1|title=PG G.J. Vilarino: Visiting Gonzaga This Weekend|last=Telep|first=Dave|publisher=''[[MSN]]''|accessdate=2010-12-21}} He was then officially signed to Gonzaga on April 27, 2009.{{cite web|url=http://scouthoops.scout.com/a.z?s=75&p=2&c=860638&ssf=1&RequestedURL=http%3a%2f%2fscouthoops.scout.com%2f2%2f860638.html|title=Vilarino Heads West|last=Telep|first=Dave|publisher=''[[MSN]]''|accessdate=2010-12-21}} Before signing to Gonzaga, Vilarino also considered signing with the [[Rutgers Scarlet Knights men's basketball|Rutgers Scarlet Knights]], [[Memphis Tigers men's basketball|Memphis Tigers]], [[Baylor Bears men's basketball|Baylor Bears]], and the [[Virginia Commonwealth Rams men's basketball|Virginia Commenwealth Rams]].{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/mens-college-basketball/recruiting/player/_/id/43092|title=G.J. Vilarino 2009 Basketball Recruiting Profile|publisher=''[[ESPN.com]]''|accessdate=2010-12-21}} {{College Athlete Recruit Start|40=no|collapse=no|year=2009}} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = G.J. [[Coaches' Poll|Coaches]] | style="background:#FFF;" | RV | style="background:#FFF;" | RV | style="background:#FFF;" | RV | style="background:#D8FFEB;" | 16 | style="background:#FFE6E6;" | 22 | style="background:#D8FFEB;" | 15Ñ | style="background:#FFE6E6;" | 24 | style="background:#D8FFEB;" | 22 | style="background:#D8FFEB;" | 18 | style="background:#D8FFEB;" | 14 | style="background:#D8FFEB;"| 10 | style="background:#D8FFEB;" | 8 | style="background:#FFE6E6;" | 13 | style="background:#D8FFEB;" | 11 | style="background:#D8FFEB;" | 9 | style="background:#FFE6E6;" | 15 | style="background:#D8FFEB;" | 14 | style="background:#FFF;" | 14 | style="background:#FFE6E6;" | 18 |} ==Season== ===Preconference=== Gonzaga opened the season with a 94–53 exhibition victory over [[Alberta Golden Bears|Alberta]] on November 2. Matt Bouldin led the team with 17 points, followed by Sam Dower with 15 points and Robert Sacre with 11 points.{{vcite web|url=http://www.gozags.com/sports/m-baskbl/recaps/110309aaa.html|title=Few Likes What He Sees In 94–53 Exhibition Victory|accessdate=2010-12-26|date=2009-11-02|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]}} Gonzaga led by as many as 26 points in the second half as they earned a 92–74 victory over [[Mississippi Valley State University|Mississippi Valley State]] on November 14. Four Gonzaga players scored in double-figures, including Bouldin with a game-high 22 points, Elias Harris with 18, Steven Gray with 16, and Sacre with 17.{{vcite web|url=http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=293182250|title=Mississippi Valley State Delta Devils vs. Gonzaga Bulldogs â Recap â November 14, 2009|accessdate=2010-12-27|date=2009-11-14|publisher=[[ESPN.com|ESPN Internet Ventures]]}} On November 17, they played against [[2009â10 Michigan State Spartans men's basketball team|Michigan State]] at the [[Jack Breslin Student Events Center]] and finished with a 75–71 loss against the second-ranked Spartans.{{vcite web|url=http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=293210127|title=Summers' big shots help Spartans take, hold lead against Gonzaga|accessdate=2010-12-27|date=2009-11-17|publisher=[[ESPN.com|ESPN Internet Ventures]]}} Sacre managed to match his career-high of 17 points, despite playing only 19 minutes in the game.{{vcite web|url=http://www.gozags.com/sports/m-baskbl/recaps/111709aaa.html|title=Gonzaga, Michigan State Play Another Basketball Classic|accessdate=2010-12-27|date=2009-11-17|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]}} The Zags returned home and finished with a 90â55 victory over [[IPFW Mastodons|IPFW]] on November 20. Sacre lead Gonzaga with 15 points, 8 rebounds, and 2 blocks.{{vcite web|url=http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=293252250|title=Gonzaga 90, IPFW 55|accessdate=2010-12-27|date=2009-11-20|publisher=[[ESPN.com|ESPN Internet Ventures]]}} During [[Thanksgiving (United States)|Thanksgiving]] week, Gonzaga participated in the [[2009 Maui Invitational Tournament]] at the [[Lahaina Civic Center]] in [[Lahaina, Hawaii]].{{vcite web|url=http://www.gozags.com/sports/m-baskbl/spec-rel/112109aab.html|title=Bulldogs Return To EA Sports Maui Invitational|accessdate=2010-12-28|date=2009-11-21|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]}} On November 23, they defeated [[Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball|Colorado]] 76–72 during the opening round of the tournament. Steven Gray scored a game-high 27 points to help the Zags overcome a bad first half.{{vcite web|url=http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=293272250|title=Gonzaga 76, Colorado 72|accessdate=2010-12-28|date=2009-11-23|publisher=[[ESPN.com|ESPN Internet Ventures]]}} In the second round of the tournament on November 24, Gonzaga defeated [[Wisconsin Badgers men's basketball|Wisconsin]] 74–61. Four Gonzaga players scored in double digits, which helped the Zags maintain a double digit lead for most of the second half.{{vcite web|url=http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=293280275|title=Gonzaga 74, Wisconsin 61|accessdate=2010-12-28|date=2009-11-24|publisher=[[ESPN.com|ESPN Internet Ventures]]}} On November 25, Gonzaga beat [[Cincinnati Bearcats|Cincinnati]] 61–59 to win the Maui Invitational for the first time in school history. Steven Gray lead the Zags with 13 points, 7 rebounds, and 4 assists.{{vcite web|url=http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=293292250|title=Gonzaga edges Cincinnati for Maui Invitational title|accessdate=2010-12-28|date=2009-11-25|publisher=[[ESPN.com|ESPN Internet Ventures]]}} ==Schedule== {{CBB Schedule Start|time=|rank=|ranklink=|rankyear=2009-10|tv=|attend=yes}} |- !colspan=9|
